articles.headline: Use of E-Cigarettes Rises Sharply Among Teenagers, Report Says
articles.snippet: A study released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says use of the devices among middle and high school students tripled between 2013 and 2014.
articles.abstract: A study released by the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention says use of the devices among middle and high school students tripled between 2013 and 2014.
articles.lead_paragraph: Kenny, a high school senior in Weston, Fla., likes to puff e-cigarettes during study sessions with friends after school. James, a senior in Fauquier County, Va., uses them outside at lunch with friends who do smoke tricks. Tom, a sophomore from Westchester County, uses them while hiking with friends.

articles.headline: Deal Reached on Fast-Track Authority for Obama on Trade Accord
articles.snippet: Congressional leaders agreed on legislation to give President Obama authority to finish negotiating one of the world’s largest trade accords, starting a battle that aligns the president with Republicans.
articles.abstract: Congressional leaders agreed on legislation to give President Obama authority to finish negotiating one of the world’s largest trade accords, starting a battle that aligns the president with Republicans.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Key congressional leaders agreed on Thursday on legislation to give President Obama special authority to finish negotiating one of the world’s largest trade accords, opening a rare battle that aligns the president with Republicans against a broad coalition of Democrats.

articles.headline: A Yale Graduate Leaves a Trail of Ventures and Debts
articles.snippet: Joshua Bryce Newman seems to fit the part of the young, successful entrepreneur. But the lawsuits filed against him paint a different picture.
articles.abstract: Joshua Bryce Newman seems to fit the part of the young, successful entrepreneur. But the lawsuits filed against him paint a different picture.
articles.lead_paragraph: In many ways, Joshua Bryce Newman fits the part of the young, successful entrepreneur.

articles.headline: For Jeb Bush the Businessman, Some Deals Brought Grief
articles.snippet: Real estate ventures and involvement with a pump manufacturer caused difficulties for the former governor of Florida, who is expected to seek the Republican Party’s nomination for president.
articles.abstract: Real estate ventures and involvement with a pump manufacturer caused difficulties for the former governor of Florida, who is expected to seek the Republican Party’s nomination for president.
articles.lead_paragraph: Barely a month after his father’s inauguration as president in 1989, Jeb Bush and his new business partners landed in Nigeria.

articles.headline: Some Fear Fallout From Preet Bharara’s Tension With Judges
articles.snippet: Judges have criticized Mr. Bharara, the United States attorney, in two recent cases and for a remark he made last summer at a party for a departing prosecutor.
articles.abstract: Judges have criticized Mr. Bharara, the United States attorney, in two recent cases and for a remark he made last summer at a party for a departing prosecutor.
articles.lead_paragraph: Preet Bharara, the United States attorney for the Southern District of New York and one of the most acclaimed prosecutors of his generation, is locked in what seems to be an escalating war of words with the federal judiciary — one that some judges fear could influence important rulings.

articles.headline: For Lucasfilm, the Way of Its Force Lies in Its ‘Star Wars’ Fans
articles.snippet: At a time when creating fan communities has become crucial to the success of all kinds of movies, Lucasfilm remains the most skilled at this art.
articles.abstract: At a time when creating fan communities has become crucial to the success of all kinds of movies, Lucasfilm remains the most skilled at this art.
articles.lead_paragraph: ANAHEIM, Calif. — Even in the social media age, some movie studios still see fans as zoo animals to be force-fed: We, the cool film people, will tell you, the easily manipulated consumers, what to like. Other Hollywood companies have developed a true appreciation for the geek masses, but they are still learning how to hone a strategy.

articles.headline: U.N. Calls on Western Nations to Shelter Syrian Refugees
articles.snippet: Not since the wave of people fleeing war in Vietnam have the world’s industrialized countries been under such intense pressure to share the burden of taking in refugees, experts say.
articles.abstract: Not since the wave of people fleeing war in Vietnam have the world’s industrialized countries been under such intense pressure to share the burden of taking in refugees, experts say.
articles.lead_paragraph: UNITED NATIONS — With Syria’s neighbors increasingly shutting their borders to refugees and thousands trying to cross the Mediterranean Sea in search of safety, the war in Syria is creating the worst global refugee crisis in decades, putting new pressure on the United States and other Western countries to open their doors — and in turn, prompting domestic political backlash.

articles.headline: Bloomberg Terminals Suffer Widespread Failures
articles.snippet: The company said hardware and software failures were to blame, but added that service had been “fully restored.”
articles.abstract: The company said hardware and software failures were to blame, but added that service had been “fully restored.”
articles.lead_paragraph: The web that weaves together much of the global financial ecosystem went down for a few hours on Friday when the Bloomberg data and communication network unexpectedly crashed.
articles.byline: By Nathaniel Popper and Neil Gough

articles.headline: General Electric Reports Strong Growth in Industrial Businesses
articles.snippet: The impact of shedding GE Capital, its finance unit, was reflected in an overall loss of $13.6 billion for the quarter.
articles.abstract: The impact of shedding GE Capital, its finance unit, was reflected in an overall loss of $13.6 billion for the quarter.
articles.lead_paragraph: Last week, General Electric declared that it was substantially accelerating its retreat from finance to bet its future on its industrial business.

articles.headline: Once-Prized Tibetan Mastiffs Are Discarded as Fad Ends in China
articles.snippet: During the heights of a Tibetan mastiff craze, the dogs fetched as much as $200,000 each. Now, some are being sold to a slaughterhouse for $5 a head.
articles.abstract: During the heights of a Tibetan mastiff craze, the dogs fetched as much as $200,000 each. Now, some are being sold to a slaughterhouse for $5 a head.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — There once was a time, during the frenzied heights of China’s Tibetan mastiff craze, when a droopy-eyed slobbering giant like Nibble might have fetched $200,000 and ended up roaming the landscaped grounds of some coal tycoon’s suburban villa.
